body.p:
His Exly Thomas E. Bramlette
Frankfort March 21/65
My dear Sir,

I have been informed that there is now confined in the penitentiary & has been for a year or more, a mulatto freeman for attempting to run away with a mulatto girl, who was a Slave, in order to marry her -- Now, you know, I am no Abolitionist I would be as far as any man no earth from violating, or justifying the violation of the rights of the owner of a slave. but while the whole State, county & town & village, is filled with white men, in the constent habit of running off slaves -- men women & children, without the motive of feeling influencing this coloured man, & yet going "unwhipt of justice", I respectfully urge that it is a cruel mockery to keep this man longer confined -- He was raised in a barber Shop in Lexington by a remarkably respectable freeman of colour, and always bore a fair character for honesty & truth -- I therefore petition you to pardon him for the residue of his term of confinement & in so doing do but simple justice, in mercy --

Marion & Adair Cir Ct
vs
A. Ginger ^F. M. C.^ & Thos Johnson
Pardoned
25th Apl/65
